p: H9N2 viruses were first isolated from turkeys in the US state of Wisconsin in 1966 [ 8]. In the following decades, the virus was occasionally isolated during sporadic outbreaks in poultry in the Northern USA, and from wild birds and domestic ducks throughout Eurasia [ 9]. In the early 1990s, the virus was first isolated from chickens in China and in the following decades viruses related to this Chinese progenitor have become endemic in farmed poultry across much of Asia, the Middle East and North and West Africa [ 10] (see Figure 1).
